column3: @rebroad Have you tried compiling this locally?\n
Please don't submit code you haven't even tried yourself.\n

@sipa Apologies.. I didn't expect anyone would look at it until Travis had given it the all clear - is there a preferred way to get Travis to look at my code before any of the Core developers, such as yourself, do?\n

It's fine to submit a pull request you're confident about to get all the
testing Travis does. But please try compiling things yourself first before
wasting other's time.

In this case you're clearly missing a file. It would also be nice to credit
the original author of the code...
I think it is abusing Travis for submitting codes that clearly won't compile\n

@sipa The author is already clearly credited - Gavin's photo appears next to the commit, and it would be Gavin's name, as far as I know that would appear in the commit log - although I'm not sure this is ideal given that I made some edits to it - anyway, I was mostly testing, and perhaps @jl2012 is correct when saying I was abusing Travis! I'm not aware of a Travis policy, so if there is one, plea
@rebroad Well at least first get your code to run fine for yourself...\n
